Structs/SegmenteControl.html#/s:7ArgoKit.name: init(onSegmentedChange:_:)
Structs/SegmenteControl.html#/s:7ArgoKit.abstract: Initializes the segmented control with the given items. Items may be NSStrings, UIImages, or (as of iOS 14.0) UIActions. When constructing from a UIAction segments will prefer images over titles when both are provided. The segmented control is automatically sized to fit content.

Structs/SegmenteControl.html#/s:7ArgoKit.name: insertSegment(action:at:animated:)
Structs/SegmenteControl.html#/s:7ArgoKit.abstract: Insert a segment with the given action at the given index. Segments will prefer images over titles when both are provided. When the segment is selected UIAction.actionHandler is called. If a segment already exists with the action’s identifier that segment will either be updated (if the index is the same) or it will be removed (if different).

Structs/SegmenteControl.html#/s:7ArgoKit.name: setAction(_:forSegmentAt:)
Structs/SegmenteControl.html#/s:7ArgoKit.abstract: Reconfigures the given segment with this action. Segments will prefer images over titles when both are provided. When the segment is selected UIAction.actionHandler is called. UIAction.identifier must either match the action of the existing segment at this index, or be unique within all actions associated with the segmented control, or this method will assert.

Protocols/View.html#/s:7ArgoKit4ViewPAAE.name: flexDirection(_:)
Protocols/View.html#/s:7ArgoKit4ViewPAAE.abstract: Flex direction controls the direction in which children of a node are laid out. This is also referred to as the main axis. The main axis is the direction in which children are laid out. The cross axis the the axis perpendicular to the main axis, or the axis which wrapping lines are laid out in.

Protocols/View.html#/s:7ArgoKit4ViewPAAE.name: justifyContent(_:)
Protocols/View.html#/s:7ArgoKit4ViewPAAE.abstract: Ustify content describes how to align children within the main axis of their container. For example, you can use this property to center a child horizontally within a container with flex direction set to row or vertically within a container with flex direction set to column.

Protocols/View.html#/s:7ArgoKit4ViewPAAE.name: alignContent(_:)
Protocols/View.html#/s:7ArgoKit4ViewPAAE.abstract: Align content defines the distribution of lines along the cross-axis. This only has effect when items are wrapped to multiple lines using flex wrap.

Protocols/View.html#/s:7ArgoKit4ViewPAAE.name: alignItems(_:)
Protocols/View.html#/s:7ArgoKit4ViewPAAE.abstract: Align items describes how to align children along the cross axis of their container. Align items is very similar to justify content but instead of applying to the main axis, align items applies to the cross axis.

Protocols/View.html#/s:7ArgoKit4ViewPAAE.name: alignSelf(_:)
Protocols/View.html#/s:7ArgoKit4ViewPAAE.abstract: Align self has the same options and effect as align items but instead of affecting the children within a container, you can apply this property to a single child to change its alignment within its parent. align self overrides any option set by the parent with align items.

Protocols/View.html#/s:7ArgoKit4ViewPAAE.name: wrap(_:)
Protocols/View.html#/s:7ArgoKit4ViewPAAE.abstract: The flex wrap property is set on containers and controls what happens when children overflow the size of the container along the main axis. By default children are forced into a single line (which can shrink elements).

Protocols/View.html#/s:7ArgoKit4ViewPAAE.name: flex(_:)
Protocols/View.html#/s:7ArgoKit4ViewPAAE.abstract: Sets how a flex item will grow or shrink to fit the space available in its flex container.

Protocols/View.html#/s:7ArgoKit4ViewPAAE.name: grow(_:)
Protocols/View.html#/s:7ArgoKit4ViewPAAE.abstract: Sets the flex grow factor of a flex item’s main size.

Protocols/View.html#/s:7ArgoKit4ViewPAAE.name: shrink(_:)
Protocols/View.html#/s:7ArgoKit4ViewPAAE.abstract: Sets the flex shrink factor of a flex item. If the size of all flex items is larger than the flex container, items shrink to fit according to flex-shrink.

Protocols/View.html#/s:7ArgoKit4ViewPAAE.name: basis(_:)
Protocols/View.html#/s:7ArgoKit4ViewPAAE.abstract: Sets the initial main size of a flex item.

Protocols/View.html#/s:7ArgoKit4ViewPAAE.abstract: The position type of this view defines how it is positioned within its parent.

Protocols/View.html#/s:7ArgoKit4ViewPAAE.name: padding(edge:value:)

Enums/ArgoWrapType.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A8Wr.name: noWrap
Enums/ArgoWrapType.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A8Wr.abstract: The flex items are laid out in a single line which may cause the flex container to overflow. The cross-start is either equivalent to start or before depending on the flex-direction value. This is the default value.

Enums/ArgoWrapType.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A8Wr.name: wrap
Enums/ArgoWrapType.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A8Wr.abstract: The flex items break into multiple lines. The cross-start is either equivalent to start or before depending flex-direction value and the cross-end is the opposite of the specified cross-start.

Enums/ArgoWrapType.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A8Wr.name: wrapReverse
Enums/ArgoWrapType.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A8Wr.abstract: Behaves the same as wrap but cross-start and cross-end are permuted.

Enums/ArgoPositionType.html#/s:7ArgoKit0.name: relative
Enums/ArgoPositionType.html#/s:7ArgoKit0.abstract: By default a view is positioned relatively. This means a view is positioned according to the normal flow of the layout, and then offset relative to that position based on the values of top, right, bottom, and left. The offset does not affect the position of any sibling or parent elements.

Enums/ArgoPositionType.html#/s:7ArgoKit0.name: absolute
Enums/ArgoPositionType.html#/s:7ArgoKit0.abstract: When positioned absolutely a view doesn’t take part in the normal layout flow. It is instead laid out independent of its siblings. The position is determined based on the top, right, bottom, and left values.

Enums/ArgoAlign.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A5Align.name: start
Enums/ArgoAlign.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A5Align.abstract: Align wrapped lines to the start of the container’s cross axis. default

Enums/ArgoAlign.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A5Align.name: center
Enums/ArgoAlign.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A5Align.abstract: Align wrapped lines in the center of the container’s cross axis.

Enums/ArgoAlign.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A5Align.name: end
Enums/ArgoAlign.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A5Align.abstract: Align wrapped lines to the end of the container’s cross axis.

Enums/ArgoAlign.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A5Align.name: stretch
Enums/ArgoAlign.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A5Align.abstract: Stretch wrapped lines to match the height of the container’s cross axis.

Enums/ArgoAlign.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A5Align.name: baseline
Enums/ArgoAlign.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A5Align.abstract: Evenly space wrapped lines across the container’s main axis, distributing remaining space along a common baseline.

Enums/ArgoAlign.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A5Align.name: between
Enums/ArgoAlign.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A5Align.abstract: Evenly space wrapped lines across the container’s main axis, distributing remaining space between the lines.

Enums/ArgoAlign.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A5Align.name: around
Enums/ArgoAlign.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A5Align.abstract: Evenly space wrapped lines across the container’s main axis, distributing remaining space around the lines. Compared to space between using space around will result in space being distributed to the begining of the first lines and end of the last line.

Enums/ArgoJustify.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A7Jus.name: start
Enums/ArgoJustify.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A7Jus.abstract: Align children of a container to the start of the container’s main axis.

Enums/ArgoJustify.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A7Jus.name: center
Enums/ArgoJustify.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A7Jus.abstract: Align children of a container in the center of the container’s main axis.

Enums/ArgoJustify.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A7Jus.name: end
Enums/ArgoJustify.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A7Jus.abstract: Align children of a container to the end of the container’s main axis.

Enums/ArgoJustify.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A7Jus.name: between
Enums/ArgoJustify.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A7Jus.abstract: Evenly space of children across the container’s main axis, distributing remaining space between the children.

Enums/ArgoJustify.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A7Jus.name: around
Enums/ArgoJustify.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A7Jus.abstract: Evenly space of children across the container’s main axis, distributing remaining space around the children. Compared to space between using space around will result in space being distributed to the beginning of the first child and end of the last child.

Enums/ArgoJustify.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A7Jus.name: evenly
Enums/ArgoJustify.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A7Jus.abstract: Evenly distributed within the alignment container along the main axis. The spacing between each pair of adjacent items, the main-start edge and the first item, and the main-end edge and the last item, are all exactly the same.

Enums/ArgoFlexDirection.html#/s:7ArgoKit.name: column
Enums/ArgoFlexDirection.html#/s:7ArgoKit.abstract: Align children from top to bottom. If wrapping is enabled then the next line will start to the left first item on the top of the container.

Enums/ArgoFlexDirection.html#/s:7ArgoKit.name: columnReverse
Enums/ArgoFlexDirection.html#/s:7ArgoKit.abstract: Align children from bottom to top. If wrapping is enabled then the next line will start to the left first item on the bottom of the container.

Enums/ArgoFlexDirection.html#/s:7ArgoKit.name: row
Enums/ArgoFlexDirection.html#/s:7ArgoKit.abstract: Align children from left to right. If wrapping is enabled then the next line will start under the first item on the left of the container.

Enums/ArgoFlexDirection.html#/s:7ArgoKit.name: rowReverse
Enums/ArgoFlexDirection.html#/s:7ArgoKit.abstract: Align children from right to left. If wrapping is enabled then the next line will start under the first item on the right of the container.

Enums/ArgoDirection.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A9D.name: LTR
Enums/ArgoDirection.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A9D.abstract: Text and children and laid out from left to right. Margin and padding applied the start of a view are applied on the left side.

Enums/ArgoDirection.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A9D.name: RTL
Enums/ArgoDirection.html#/s:7ArgoKit0A9D.abstract: Text and children and laid out from right to left. Margin and padding applied the start of a view are applied on the right side.

Enums/AnimationTimingFunc.html#/s:7ArgoK.name: defaultValue
Enums/AnimationTimingFunc.html#/s:7ArgoK.abstract: The default timing function. Use this function to ensure that the timing of your animations matches that of most animations.

Enums/AnimationTimingFunc.html#/s:7ArgoK.name: linear
Enums/AnimationTimingFunc.html#/s:7ArgoK.abstract: Linear pacing, which causes an animation to occur evenly over its duration.

Enums/AnimationTimingFunc.html#/s:7ArgoK.name: easeIn
Enums/AnimationTimingFunc.html#/s:7ArgoK.abstract: Ease-in pacing, which causes an animation to begin slowly and then speed up as it progresses.

Enums/AnimationTimingFunc.html#/s:7ArgoK.name: easeOut
Enums/AnimationTimingFunc.html#/s:7ArgoK.abstract: Ease-out pacing, which causes an animation to begin quickly and then slow as it progresses.

Enums/AnimationTimingFunc.html#/s:7ArgoK.name: easeInEaseOut
Enums/AnimationTimingFunc.html#/s:7ArgoK.abstract: Ease-in-ease-out pacing, which causes an animation to begin slowly, accelerate through the middle of its duration, and then slow again before completing.

Enums/AnimationTimingFunc.html.name: AnimationTimingFunc
Enums/AnimationTimingFunc.html.abstract: An optional timing function defining the pacing of the animation.

Enums/AnimationElement.html.name: AnimationElement
Enums/AnimationElement.html.abstract: The element of animation that used to describe the animation properties you want to set.

Enums/AnimationGroupElement.html.name: AnimationGroupElement
Enums/AnimationGroupElement.html.abstract: The element of animation that used to describe the animation group properties you want to set.

Enums/ArgoDirection.html.name: ArgoDirection
Enums/ArgoDirection.html.abstract: Layout direction specifies the direction in which children and text in a hierarchy should be laid out. Layout direction also effects what edge start and end refer to. By default Yoga lays out with LTR layout direction. In this mode start refers to left and end refers to right. When localizing your apps for markets with RTL languages you should customize this by either by passing a direction to the CalculateLayout call or by setting the direction on the root node.
